pain_points_original.title: Lack of Market Visibility for AI Planning
pain_points_original.description: DPC lacks comprehensive knowledge of the "current landscape" of AI tools available to support government. They need to aggregate this intelligence to build a "catalogue of offerings" that will inform "subsequent project planning, procurement strategies, and policy development" beginning in 2026.

pain_points_original.title: Strict Data Security and Privacy Compliance
pain_points_original.description: AI solutions must rigorously comply with "Applicable ICT, Security and Cyber policies" and "South Australian Information Privacy Principles (IPPs)." DPC requires detailed proof of measures taken to "protect sensitive information" and manage data usage policies to mitigate high-stakes compliance risks.

pain_points_original.title: LLM and Third-Party Risk Management
pain_points_original.description: DPC highlights specific risks regarding tools that integrate with "third-party offerings, particularly large language models (LLMs)." Vendors must explicitly articulate safeguarding measures for government data in these contexts, aligning with internal "Use-of-Large-Language-Model" guidelines.

pain_points_original.title: Integration with Legacy Government Systems
pain_points_original.description: New tools must not be standalone silos; DPC needs to assess "maturity, scalability, and adaptability" for "integration into existing government systems." Vendors must define "integration needs with any existing systems and platforms" and infrastructure requirements to ensure technical viability.

pain_points_original.title: Operational Efficiency and Service Delivery
pain_points_original.description: Agencies are under pressure to "boost efficiency, inform decision-making, and drive innovation" to improve "service delivery" and "increase public satisfaction." DPC needs solutions that tangibly address these operational deficits rather than just offering novel technology without clear utility.

pain_points_original.title: Budgetary Uncertainty for AI Adoption
pain_points_original.description: DPC faces a challenge in financial planning for emerging tech. They require "indicative costing models and pricing structures" to allow them to "estimate the total costs" and effectively manage "future procurement planning and budget allocation" for unpriced innovations.

pain_points_original.title: Unproven Viability in Government Sectors
pain_points_original.description: To mitigate the risk of failure, DPC needs to validate "technical capability, reliability and performance history" in environments "similar to DPC." They are specifically seeking "lessons learned and best practices" from "successful deployments in a government sector" to justify adoption.
